intro: Touchiroa spicata, commonly known as the spiky touchiroa, is a unique plant species native to specific regions of New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive spiky foliage, which gives it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the genus Touchiroa, which is part of the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. Its botanical features include compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Touchiroa spicata is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in the undergrowth of native forests.
